remarks: Two ways to express single-valuedness of a class expression ` C ( y ) ` .  Note that ` U. A = |^| A ` means ` A ` is a singleton ( ~ uniintsn ).  (Contributed by NM, 14-Dec-2012.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
reusv7.1 $e |- ( y e. B -> C e. A ) $.
reusv7OLD $p |- ( ( U. A =/= |^| A \/ B =/= (/) ) -> ( E! x e. A E. y e. B x = C <-> E! x e. A A. y e. B x = C ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d C x $.
